column4: <nathanhelp> You can perform an upgrade but I advise you to folow the upgrade recommendations. For productive systems I'd run upgrade on a testmachine before.
wash you can build g++ yourself with "sudo apt-get install -b <package>". This may require you to install "apt-build".
Nevertheless I think your system is broken, wash. g++ and gcc install without problems on a newly installed ubuntu system.
there seems to be a bug along the gcc/compiler pack in Ubuntu 9.10. experienced that on all my 9.10 servers
